title: Internal Seller Management System
description: An internal operations tool for the Account Management team to manage seller onboarding, documents, payments, proposals, and lifecycle tracking. This system is used only by internal users and integrates with Google Drive for document storage. The UI is built using shadcn/ui for a clean, consistent, and visually appealing internal experience.
assumptions: Seller documents are stored in Google Drive
Document links are manually pasted after upload to Google Drive
shadcn/ui is used as the primary UI component library
PostgreSQL is the only supported relational database

notes: Database schema should be designed for structured relational data
JSON/JSONB fields may be used where flexibility is required

design_principles: Consistency across all forms and lists
Readable, scannable layouts optimized for daily operational use
Prefer shadcn/ui components over custom-built UI
Data integrity and auditability over quick prototyping shortcuts

modules.name: Seller Registry
modules.description: Create and manage seller profiles with structured internal metadata.
features: Capture service note for offered services

modules.name: Document Management
modules.description: Track seller documents stored in Google Drive using metadata and links.
features: Add document entry with file name, tag, and Google Drive link
Display document list in a structured and readable format
Open document via clickable Google Drive link

modules.name: Payments & Invoices
modules.description: Track seller payments and generate invoices.

modules.name: Internal Notes & Context
modules.description: Maintain internal operational context for each seller.

ui_expectations: Use shadcn/ui components for all forms, tables, dialogs, and layouts
Document list should be presented using a table or list pattern with clear spacing
Document links must open Google Drive in a new browser tab
Forms should use consistent validation and error messaging
Optional fields must not block seller creation
UI should prioritize clarity and speed for internal users
